newsitem.title: UK: Dated Brent edges down on difficult U.S. arbitrage.
newsitem.headline: Dated Brent edges down on difficult U.S. arbitrage.

text.p: North Sea values for most grades were steady on Friday in slim business, but benchmark Dated Brent edged lower again.
October 28-30 cargoes sold at Nov -5 and -6 cents after trading at parity on Thursday and +10 cents on Wednesday.
Dealers said a difficult arbitrage to the U.S. was keeping the pressure on Dated premiums but that the seller was again keen to take advantage of operational tolerance on a maximum Brent sale.
Five of six end-October Brent cargoes were kept voluntarily on Friday.
CFD values for next week slipped about 10 cents to sell at Nov -9 cents.
Transatlantic traders were examining VLCC economics for U.S. Gulf sales but remained reluctant to commit, given a sub-Brent/WTI spread below $1.
Other North Sea grades were slow ahead of next week's November programmes, with most grades expected to be announced on Tuesday.
A couple each of October Oseberg and Ekofisk probably still had to find homes.
Early November sales on Friday appeared limited to a pair of DUCs, done at 10-11 cent premiums over Brent.
Nigerian prices remained difficult to pin down ahead of next week's NNPC term pricing release.
Contract holders were keen to keep rising differentials under wraps but Forcados was indicated at around Dated Brent +80 cents, Bonny Light at +70 cents.
Med Urals values were helped by the prospect of maintenance at Novorossiisk and assessed closer to Brent -60 cents cif Med than -70 cents.
